metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1094 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The ext4_fill_super function in fs/ext4/super.c in the Linux kernel through4.15.15 does not always initialize the crc32c checksum driver, which allowsattackers to cause a denial of service (ext4_xattr_inode_hash NULL pointerdereference and system crash) via a crafted ext4 image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1094` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

No subscription required
